intro: Viola × subaffinis, commonly known as the common violet, is a hybrid species within the viola genus. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant is native to Europe and has been introduced to other regions, including North America. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Viola × subaffinis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to naturalize in suitable environments.
